awd_titl_txt: Interactions Between Monolayers and Molecules:  A Basis for Molecular Recognition
awd_abstract_narration: This grant is a renewal of Professor Crooks' fundamental                        investigation of molecular recognition phenomena observed in                    organized chemical systems.  The project in the Analytical and                  Surface Chemistry Program will involve experimental and                         theoretical studies of thin films of organosulfur compounds                     chemisorbed on gold surfaces, i. e., so-called self-assembled                   monolayers (SAMs).  The investigations will center on the                       electrostatic and hydrogen-bonding interactions between probe                   molecules and the adsorbed monolayers.  The goal of the                         research is to develop molecular recognition strategies which                   can be used for chemical sensors.                                               %%%                                                                             Professor Crooks and his colleagues will investigate the                        chemistry of self-assembled monolayers of organosulfur                          compounds adsorbed on gold surfaces. The research results will                  be used for the development of new chemical sensors based on                    molecular recognition phenomena, new electronic materials and                   innovative lithographic techniques.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
